    Hanyu Ma

    Postdoctoral Research Associate in Environmental Catalysis
    Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering
    University of Notre Dame

    Photo credit: Unsplash

    I am a postdoc working with Prof. William Schneider at the University of Notre Dame. My postdoctoral research focuses on molecular simulation of heterogeneous catalysis, with particular emphasis on environmental remediation and non-thermal-plasma-enabled processes. My Ph.D. research involved synthesis of structure-controlled metallic nanocatalysts for reduction of aqueous contaminants and hydrogen release.

    Simulation

    Ammonia oxidation on Pt
    ACS Catalysis, 2019

    Simulation & Experiment

    NDMA reduction on Pd
    Environmental Science & Technology, 2019

    Experiment

    Ammonia borane hydrolysis on Ru
    ACS Catalysis, 2015
